alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 6:51PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The following area, Salmon River at Gustavus * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM AKST, river gauge reports indicate the Salmon River has crested at 1 pm at 16.7 ft and continues to fall. Minor flooding is ongoing but will diminish. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - For Salmon River at Gustavus : At 745pm the stage was 16.1 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Impacts: At 15.5 feet: Water will begin to flow over Wilson and Rink Creek roads and ditches will be full. Roads will be soft in places and travel across these areas will be difficult. At 16.5 feet: The Wilson and Rink Creek corridor will have 1-3 feet of water over the road to become impassable in places and structures will begin to flood. Power may be cut off from Chase Drive out to Rink Creek. - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
